channel.title: Item Values
channel.description:
[img]http://img12.imageshack.us/img12/5166/ss20090801232936.png[/img]
Can someone explain the relationship between the decimal values and the item position?

@CodeForFame wrote:

item.title: Item Values
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Vrunk, post:17, topic:455067”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=557935.msg4091481#msg4091481 date=1346429786]

They are bit masks to determine what items can / cannot be worn at the same time.
[/quote]No, that’s what wieldPos is for.

There is completely unused code, in the server, that attempts to check that using type. But it is never actually used.

Also, type is sent to the client, and the only part of the client that uses it is what I posted already. Which isn’t doing what you claim.

They are [can be used as] bit masks to determine what items can / cannot be worn at the same time [use your imagination].

What exactly do you think I am claiming? Nowhere in my response did I allude to the data being used in this and only this way. I simply gave an example usage.[/quote]It would be pretty stupid to use them for that when you already have wieldPos…

Also, you explicitly stated that it is being used that way, which is not true. This is why you had to cross out are, and replace it with can be used as.

Sure, you didn’t say that was the only thing it was used for, but the single thing it’s used for is not what you claimed.

In short, you’re wrong and are being an idiot about it. There is nothing more that needs to be said, just accept it and move on.

Read full topic

item.title: Item Values
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

Their only use is in this method:

[code]final void method52(int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1, int j1, int k1) {
Mob mob = playerArray[i1];
if (mob.colourBottomType == 255)
return;
int l1 = mob.currentSprite + (cameraRotation + 16) / 32 & 7;
boolean flag = false;
int i2 = l1;
if (i2 == 5) {
i2 = 3;
flag = true;
} else if (i2 == 6) {
i2 = 2;
flag = true;
} else if (i2 == 7) {
i2 = 1;
flag = true;
}
int j2 = i2 * 3 + walkModel[(mob.stepCount / 6) % 4];
if (mob.currentSprite == 8) {
i2 = 5;
l1 = 2;
flag = false;
i -= (5 * k1) / 100;
j2 = i2 * 3 + npcCombatModelArray1[(loginTimer / 5) % 8];
} else if (mob.currentSprite == 9) {
i2 = 5;
l1 = 2;
flag = true;
i += (5 * k1) / 100;
j2 = i2 * 3 + npcCombatModelArray2[(loginTimer / 6) % 8];
}
for (int k2 = 0; k2 < 12; k2++) {
int l2 = npcAnimationArray[l1][k2];
int l3 = mob.animationCount[l2] - 1; // Right here is where that information being used.
if (l3 >= 0) {
int k4 = 0;
int i5 = 0;
int j5 = j2;
if (flag && i2 >= 1 && i2 <= 3)
if (EntityHandler.getAnimationDef(l3).hasF())
j5 += 15;
else if (l2 == 4 && i2 == 1) {
k4 = -22;
i5 = -3;
j5 = i2 * 3 + walkModel[(2 + mob.stepCount / 6) % 4];
} else if (l2 == 4 && i2 == 2) {
k4 = 0;
i5 = -8;
j5 = i2 * 3 + walkModel[(2 + mob.stepCount / 6) % 4];
} else if (l2 == 4 && i2 == 3) {
k4 = 26;
i5 = -5;
j5 = i2 * 3 + walkModel[(2 + mob.stepCount / 6) % 4];
} else if (l2 == 3 && i2 == 1) {
k4 = 22;
i5 = 3;
j5 = i2 * 3 + walkModel[(2 + mob.stepCount / 6) % 4];
} else if (l2 == 3 && i2 == 2) {
k4 = 0;
i5 = 8;
j5 = i2 * 3 + walkModel[(2 + mob.stepCount / 6) % 4];
} else if (l2 == 3 && i2 == 3) {
k4 = -26;
i5 = 5;
j5 = i2 * 3 + walkModel[(2 + mob.stepCount / 6) % 4];
}
if (i2 != 5 || EntityHandler.getAnimationDef(l3).hasA()) {
int k5 = j5 + EntityHandler.getAnimationDef(l3).getNumber();
k4 = (k4 * k)
/ ((GameImage) (gameGraphics)).sprites[k5]
.getSomething1();
i5 = (i5 * l)
/ ((GameImage) (gameGraphics)).sprites[k5]
.getSomething2();
int l5 = (k * ((GameImage) (gameGraphics)).sprites[k5]
.getSomething1())
/ ((GameImage) (gameGraphics)).sprites[EntityHandler
.getAnimationDef(l3).getNumber()]
.getSomething1();
k4 -= (l5 - k) / 2;
int colour = EntityHandler.getAnimationDef(l3)
.getCharColour();
int skinColour = characterSkinColours[mob.colourSkinType];
if (colour == 1)
colour = characterHairColours[mob.colourHairType];
else if (colour == 2)
colour = characterTopBottomColours[mob.colourTopType];
else if (colour == 3)
colour = characterTopBottomColours[mob.colourBottomType];
gameGraphics.spriteClip4(i + k4, j + i5, l5, l, k5, colour,
skinColour, j1, flag);
}
}
}

	if (mob.lastMessageTimeout > 0) {
		mobMessagesWidth[mobMessageCount] = gameGraphics.textWidth(
				mob.lastMessage, 1) / 2;
		if (mobMessagesWidth[mobMessageCount] > 150)
			mobMessagesWidth[mobMessageCount] = 150;
		mobMessagesHeight[mobMessageCount] = (gameGraphics.textWidth(
				mob.lastMessage, 1) / 300)
				* gameGraphics.messageFontHeight(1);
		mobMessagesX[mobMessageCount] = i + k / 2;
		mobMessagesY[mobMessageCount] = j;
		mobMessages[mobMessageCount++] = mob.lastMessage;
	}
	if (mob.anInt163 > 0) {
		anIntArray858[anInt699] = i + k / 2;
		anIntArray859[anInt699] = j;
		anIntArray705[anInt699] = k1;
		anIntArray706[anInt699++] = mob.anInt162;
	}
	if (mob.currentSprite == 8 || mob.currentSprite == 9
			|| mob.combatTimer != 0) {
		if (mob.combatTimer > 0) {
			int i3 = i;
			if (mob.currentSprite == 8)
				i3 -= (20 * k1) / 100;
			else if (mob.currentSprite == 9)
				i3 += (20 * k1) / 100;
			int i4 = (mob.hitPointsCurrent * 30) / mob.hitPointsBase;
			anIntArray786[anInt718] = i3 + k / 2;
			anIntArray787[anInt718] = j;
			anIntArray788[anInt718++] = i4;
		}
		if (mob.combatTimer > 150) {
			int j3 = i;
			if (mob.currentSprite == 8)
				j3 -= (10 * k1) / 100;
			else if (mob.currentSprite == 9)
				j3 += (10 * k1) / 100;
			gameGraphics.drawPicture((j3 + k / 2) - 12, (j + l / 2) - 12,
					SPRITE_MEDIA_START + 11);
			gameGraphics.drawText(String.valueOf(mob.anInt164),
					(j3 + k / 2) - 1, j + l / 2 + 5, 3, 0xffffff);
		}
	}
	if (mob.anInt179 == 1 && mob.anInt163 == 0) {
		int k3 = j1 + i + k / 2;
		if (mob.currentSprite == 8)
			k3 -= (20 * k1) / 100;
		else if (mob.currentSprite == 9)
			k3 += (20 * k1) / 100;
		int j4 = (16 * k1) / 100;
		int l4 = (16 * k1) / 100;
		gameGraphics.spriteClip1(k3 - j4 / 2, j - l4 / 2 - (10 * k1) / 100,
				j4, l4, SPRITE_MEDIA_START + 13);
	}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Item Values
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:3, topic:455067”]Well to start off, why is shield valued 8? Why is 1H Weapon valued 16?[/quote]Why not group the same type of item together? It’s not like they use different sprites for each kind of 2h…

It makes all sorts of calculations easier when you group like things together.

Read full topic
